criteria.description: Extract the effective date or date the agreement was formed.
Extract the relevant jurisdiction or jurisdiction clause.
Extract the full names, addresses, and representative details (if mentioned) for all parties (Disclosing and Receiving).
Extract all the definitions mentioned in the Contract, including any specific examples or exclusions mentioned.
Extract any mention of third-party beneficiaries.
Extract the stated purpose or object of the NDA (e.g., specific business opportunity, discussion topic).
Extract any clauses describing the broader social or economic purpose of the contract, if explicitly stated.
Extract the obligations specifically placed upon the Disclosing Party.
Extract the obligations placed upon the Receiving Party (e.g., non-disclosure, non-use, return/destruction).
Extract the rights explicitly granted to or retained by the Disclosing Party.
Extract the rights explicitly granted to the Receiving Party (e.g., right to use for evaluation).
Extract clauses defining the duration (term) and any conditions affecting the agreement's effect or validity.
Extract the conditions or process for terminating the agreement itself .
Extract any specific penalties mentioned for breach of the agreement. Say it is: compensatory or punitive (when applicable).
Extract clauses mentioning available remedies (e.g., injunctive relief, damages).
Extract any clause related to Alternative Dispute Resolution (e.g., arbitration, mediation, negotiation).
Extract the specific clause stating the governing law.

date_of_formation.value: This Agreement is made effective as of January 1, 2024.

jurisdiction.value: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware, without regard to its conflict of laws principles.

parties_of_the_contract.value:
Disclosing Party: Innovate Corp., 123 Tech Lane, Silicon Valley, CA 94000, represented by Jane Doe, CEO.
Receiving Party: ______________ [Name and Address Missing]

definitions.value: 'Confidential Information' means all non-public information disclosed by Disclosing Party... including business plans, customer lists, and technical data, but excluding information that is publicly known.
definitions.location: Section 1. Definition of Confidential Information, Page 1

object_of_the_contract.value: The parties wish to explore a potential business relationship concerning the development of a new software product (the 'Purpose').

obligations_of_the_disclosing_party.value: Disclosing Party shall mark confidential information appropriately.

obligations_of_the_receiving_party.value: Receiving Party shall hold Confidential Information in strict confidence, use it only for the Purpose, and return or destroy it upon request.

rights_of_the_disclosing_party.value: Disclosing Party retains all rights, title, and interest in its Confidential Information.

rights_of_the_receiving_party.value: No license under any patent, copyright, or trademark is granted.

effect_clauses.value: The obligations under this Agreement shall survive for a period of five (5) years from the date of disclosure.

termination.value: This Agreement may be terminated by either party upon thirty (30) days written notice.

remedies.value: Disclosing Party is entitled to seek injunctive relief for any breach.

alternative_dispute_resolution_clauses.value: Any disputes arising under this Agreement shall be resolved through binding arbitration in Wilmington, Delaware.

governing_law_clause.value: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware.
